channel.title: Java implementation of Runescape toolbar
channel.description:
This is a java implementation of the Tunescape toolbar I don't really care about the example implementation but if anyone has any constructive feedback on improving the library I would love to hear it.
[img]http://i53.tinypic.com/308e81u.png[/img]
ToolbarExample Jar:
Usage: Just enter your runescape account details to pull your toolbar cookies I have included the binary of the toolbar example, and sources to both the example and the toolbarlib.
PS it appears I neglected to add the activities resource(I never do any) [code] new CookieHTTPXMLResource("http://services.runescape.com/m=toolbar/m=toolbar/activities.ws", hash, code), [/code]

[quote=“m.dog311, post:10, topic:380506”]Alright, time to make the toolbar for Google Chrome, since apparently Jagex are shit and only support Firefox & IE

Just realized the date: But reply is relevant & the topic is still good… So fuck you all…[/quote]

@silabsoft wrote:

I Vain I:

Would you mind telling me how I could do that?

take the config file the example i release create and place it in the folder in the one i give you later.

Read full topic

item.title: Java implementation of Runescape toolbar
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=476335.msg3483732#msg3483732 date=1296374919]
I don’t like shit toolbars in my browser, but the information the toolbar provides is worth me taking the time and implementing it in something else, For example I use it in my systemtray with a little pop up notification when GE listings change.
[/quote]Mind giving me the sysTray one?[/quote]
Sure Ill upload it shortly. it does not have any cookie grabbing method however you will need to set that yourself.

Read full topic
